<!-- Subheading: Project Overview -->
<h3 style="font-size: 1.5em; font-weight: bold; margin-bottom: 20px; color: #001731; text-align: center;">PROJECT OVERVIEW</h3>

::: {style="display: flex; gap: 20px; max-width: 1200px; margin: 0 auto;"}

<!-- Left Column -->
::: {style="flex: 1; max-width: 50%;"}

<span style="font-size: 1.2em; font-weight: bold; color: #001731;">CLIENT</span>  
Hefner Museum of Natural History  

<br>

<span style="font-size: 1.2em; font-weight: bold; color: #001731;">GOAL</span>  
Use AI to streamline the identification of museum specimens (mammal skulls) from photographs.  

<br>

<span style="font-size: 1.2em; font-weight: bold; color: #001731;">PRIMARY TOOLS</span>  
Python, FastAI, Gradio, HuggingFace  

<br>

<span style="font-size: 1.2em; font-weight: bold; color: #001731;">BACKGROUND</span>  
The client serves as a physical repository for tens of thousands of museum specimens, including hundreds of mammal skulls. These skulls occupy a large amount of physical space and pose unique storage challenges for the client. The client requires a solution for quickly identifying the type of skull in order to streamline its association with the relevant digital metadata.  

<br>

<span style="font-size: 1.2em; font-weight: bold; color: #001731;">PRODUCT</span>  
Our team developed a working prototype of a computer vision model powered by AI. The model received user input (photographs of mammal skulls) and correctly classifies them into mammalian Orders.  

:::

<!-- Details: Challenges and Solutions -->
<h3 style="font-size: 1.5em; font-weight: bold; margin-bottom: 20px; color: #001731; text-align: center;">CHALLENGES AND SOLUTIONS</h3>

<!-- Dropdown Section -->
<details style="margin-bottom: 20px;">
  <summary style="font-size: 1.2em; font-weight: bold; color: #001731; cursor: pointer; padding: 10px; background-color: #f7f7f7; border-radius: 5px;">
    TRAINING DATA SETS
  </summary>
  <p style="margin: 10px 20px; font-size: 1em; color: black;">
    <b>The Challenge</b>: the computer vision model (ResNet18) requires a sizeable library of training data. <br> <br>
    <b>The Solution</b>: source photographs of mammal skulls from publicly available museum repositories available online, including the Smithsonian NMNH and the London NHM.
  </p>
</details>

<details style="margin-bottom: 20px;">
  <summary style="font-size: 1.2em; font-weight: bold; color: #001731; cursor: pointer; padding: 10px; background-color: #f7f7f7; border-radius: 5px;">
    ON THE MOVE
  </summary>
  <p style="margin: 10px 20px; font-size: 1em; color: black;">
    <b>The Challenge</b>: the client needs a fast and agile tool that works in a collection space: often on the move and away from the office. <br> <br>
    <b>The Solution</b>: design a feature light, mobile friendly prototype that accommodates user input directly from a mobile phone camera with minimal bloat.
  </p>
</details>

<details style="margin-bottom: 20px;">
  <summary style="font-size: 1.2em; font-weight: bold; color: #001731; cursor: pointer; padding: 10px; background-color: #f7f7f7; border-radius: 5px;">
    DIVERSE USE CASES
  </summary>
  <p style="margin: 10px 20px; font-size: 1em; color: black;">
    <b>The Challenge</b>: the client has an uneven distribution of mammal skulls that span many different broad categories, but the majority fit into two large groups (artiodactyls and rodents). <br> <br>
    <b>The Solution</b>: design the working prototype around these two large groups to ensure immediate utility, then expand the model and the web app to accommodate edge cases. 
  </p>
</details>

<details style="margin-bottom: 20px;">
  <summary style="font-size: 1.2em; font-weight: bold; color: #001731; cursor: pointer; padding: 10px; background-color: #f7f7f7; border-radius: 5px;">
    EXPAND THE SCOPE
  </summary>
  <p style="margin: 10px 20px; font-size: 1em; color: black;">
    The Hefner Museum of Natural History is home to 27 of the 29 orders of mammals. We will source additional training images and expand the model to identify all 29 Orders. 
  </p>

<details style="margin-bottom: 20px;">
  <summary style="font-size: 1.2em; font-weight: bold; color: #001731; cursor: pointer; padding: 10px; background-color: #f7f7f7; border-radius: 5px;">
    IMPROVE THE BASE MODEL
  </summary>
  <p style="margin: 10px 20px; font-size: 1em; color: black;">
    We chose Resnet18 as a base model because it offers a compromise between accuracy and speed. This is ideal for fast iteration and testing. For the final product, weâ€™ll sacrifice speed for improved accuracy.
  </p>
</details>

<details style="margin-bottom: 20px;">
  <summary style="font-size: 1.2em; font-weight: bold; color: #001731; cursor: pointer; padding: 10px; background-color: #f7f7f7; border-radius: 5px;">
    LINK THE METADATA
  </summary>
  <p style="margin: 10px 20px; font-size: 1em; color: black;">

  </p>
</details>
